import "./style/aboutMe.css" import jest from "./media/jestLogo.png" import webpack from "./media/webpack.png" import ex from "./media/ex.png" import { FontAwesomeIcon } from '@fortawesome/react-fontawesome' import { faCoffee, faShoppingCart,faUser } from '@fortawesome/free-solid-svg-icons' import { faTwitter, faHtml5, faCss3, faJs, faReact, faGitAlt, faGithub, faNpm, faNodeJs, faSass } from '@fortawesome/free-brands-svg-icons' import TypeWriterEffect from 'react-typewriter-effect'; import { useEffect } from "react" import React, { useRef } from "react" import { useInView } from 'react-intersection-observer' const iconHtml = const iconCss = const iconJs = const iconReact = const iconGithub = const iconGit = const iconNpm = const iconUser = const iconNode = const iconSass = const AboutMe = () => { const myRef = document.querySelector('.scrollable-div'); const { ref, inView, entry } = useInView({ /* Optional options */ threshold: 0, }) return (

ABOUT ME

{iconUser}
{/* */}

After my degree in Japanese foreign languages, literatures and civilizations, I decided to learn code. And I was immediately hooked. Coming from a literature degree it was very fun to be in an environment with languages again, obviously programming languages are a bit different! I also immediately liked the atmosphere of the world of programming and coding, there is a lot of mutual support and sharing, it's something that I appreciate. So.. I became a Frontend developer :)

{iconHtml} HTML
{iconCss} CSS
{iconJs} JAVASCRIPT
{iconReact} REACT
{iconGithub} GITHUB
{iconGit} GIT
{iconNpm} NPM
{iconNode} NODEJS
{iconSass} SASS
EXPRESS
JEST
WEBPACK
) } export default AboutMe
